text.title: Decide if You Want to Adopt a Pet

head.s: Decide if You Want to Adopt a Pet

p.s: Having a pet can be a wonderful thing , but it takes a lot of commitment .
When deciding if you really want to adopt a pet , there are a few things to consider .

item.s: Do you have the time needed to take care of a pet ?
Whether you are thinking of getting a fish , a dog , or even a horse , you are going to need to invest a lot of time into taking care of it .
Some pets will require more time than others so when thinking about this , consider what you will need to spend time doing .
You should set aside time for :
Cleaning - Picking up messes and cleaning cages will become a big part of your life .
Training - Many pets will need some sort of training .
Even small , caged animals can be trained to make your life easier .
Exercising - All pets need time to stretch their legs and exercise .
You will need to set aside some time to walk your dog , or to make sure that the hamster does n't fall down the stairs while running around the house in its ball .
Playing -
Just like people , animals can get bored .
Spending some time interacting with your pet will not only help prevent boredom , but it will also give you a chance to improve your bond .
Are you financially equipped ?
Before getting a pet you need to make sure that you will be able to afford all of the supplies that are needed .
In most cases , food will be your number one pet expense .
Some other expenses you may encounter are vet bills , toys , litter , bedding and vaccinations .
Do research on the type of pet you are wanting to get for a better idea of what you will need .
Do you have the space needed for the pet you would like ?
If you are living in an apartment , a Great Dane may not be the pet for you .
If you are short on living space , a caged animal will be easier to live with than a larger animal that will need more space .
Having a larger animal in a small space will add to the time that you need to set aside for exercising your pet outside .
If you have considered all of the things listed above and you still want a pet , make sure to choose one that is compatible with you .
Do n't get a pet just because you think they are cool looking or because you like the idea .
Choose your pet based on how much time , money and effort you are willing to put in .
Do n't buy a pet on a whim .
Do your research and choose your new best friend wisely .
